clues.text: It's the third letter in the Greek alphabet
He had a killer term as the third U.S. vice president
The third son of Adam & Eve mentioned in the Bible, he was born after Abel was killed
The third woman on the U.S. Supreme Court, she's now the most senior female member

From the world of film: Wilder & Crudup

Providing different kinds of entertainment:
Kwan & Pfeiffer

Both can make you dance:
Allen & Gibson
Creative types Schumann & Ludlum
Very different leaders Mumford & Garvey
When but a child, this FBI agent tried unsuccessfully to save a lamb, a moment that would stay with her later in life
Kill the dog of this man, the underworld's most feared assassin? That'll bring out some hand cannons
An enchantress' curse in this 1991 Disney film forced a life of reclusiveness for one of the title pair
In "The Princess Bride", Count Rugen offers everything to this man who kills the count anyway, saying, "I want my father back"
In "Kill Bill", she played Elle Driver, who lost an eye to her master Pai Mei; she'd later see things differently
In 1781 at this battle site in Virginia, the British surrendered some 240 artillery pieces to George Washington's army
It's the female nickname for the German Howitzer that destroyed Fort Loncin in the Siege of Liège during World War I
Private John Thompson wrote, "The batteries doing us most damage were on Morris Island" during this April 1861 battle
Before a decisive 1805 battle, a few extra cannons were added to this vice admiral's HMS Victory
In 1453 this city's emperor declined to buy cannons...& then saw them used against his own walls by the Turks
"The boy with fair hair lowered himself down the last few feet of rock", begins this novel by William Golding
His fourth novel, "The Sound and the Fury", is often seen as his breakthrough into genius
This Dickens title character comes from a venerable family, as "at least one Chuzzlewit came over with William the Conqueror"
A revenge plan claims the life of the Vicomte de Valmont in this 1782 novel of scheming lovers
This Willa Cather book about folks in a new land says, "The absence of human landmarks is one of the most depressing" things
"Also known for the Flintstone Flop, Tammy D gettin' biz on the crop, Beastie Boys known to let the beat... mmm..." this!
Biggie knew "It's like the more money we come across, the more" these "we see"
He rapped, "Today I didn't even have to use my AK, I gotta say it was a good day"
Naughty By Nature hit the Top 10 with the musical question, "You down with" this? & also provided an answer: "Yeah, you know me"
In "California Love": "Now let me welcome everybody to the Wild Wild West, a state that's untouchable like" this lawman

rounds.category: CHANGE THE S TO AN N
rounds.comments: (Ken: Each response will be two words.)

clues.text: A wind-catching canvas on a ship loses its S & tacks on an N to be this hardware item
A word meaning not as much drops an S & subs in the N to be an eye part
The bottom of an object used as support subs in N for S to be someone who makes a nightmare "of my existence"
The S bows out of a word meaning to replace an actor in a role & N is the new star in a word meaning to disavow testimony
A tricky plan intended to deceive switches the S for an N to be a character in a Viking alphabet
The alliterative this "from Scratch" features tastes & treats from Denmark, Norway & Sweden
Gabriel "Gator" Guilbeau, a chef & caterer for this TV drama, put together a "Dutton Ranch Family Cookbook"
Erika Council's "Still We Rise" is "A Love Letter to" these Southern staples often served with gravy
"Plant-Based India" includes recipes for crispy masala dosa & these stews made with legumes like lentils & chickpeas
"Modern Comfort Food" & "Go-To Dinners" are among her Barefoot Contessa cookbooks
Tom Selleck is Commissioner Frank Reagan on this NYPD-centric show
Her character on "Misfits of Science" had telekinetic powers, something she lacked as friend Monica
The Satin Dolls strip club on New Jersey Route 17 became this spot on an HBO series
"I am the danger... I am the one who knocks!" said this antihero of an acclaimed (& alliterative) AMC series
About Kendall, this "Succession" character says their dad "wished that mom gave birth to a can opener... then it would be useful"
I'm doin' okay... you remember the ol' idiom, "fair to" this
How do I feel? Comme ci, comme ça, you know... this-this
Showing one's indifference, this interjection is called a "bleating" sound & defined as "be it as it may" in a 1928 dictionary
Everything is just this, meaning pleasant & also a Bowie album with some "Changes"
In the lingo of the 1930s or so, it's an adjective meaning fine & dandy or a noun meaning a dressed-up gentleman
This association is "an organization of members of the legal profession", & it's time for you to pass it
This aforethought is "the requisite mental state for common-law murder", including the intent to inflict grievous bodily harm
"A solemn declaration, accompanied by a swearing to God... that one's statement is true"
This witness "is biased against the examining party, is unwilling to testify, or is identified with an adverse party"
Alliterative item "given to a court... to guarantee that the defendant will duly appear in court in the future"
The right spot to smack on a Heinz bottle is this number to get the ketchup flowing at a brisk .028 mph
A 42-foot rocking chair in Missouri & the original McDonald's site in California are not far off this route
You can just do the math to get this number of batters faced by a Major League Baseball pitcher who threw a perfect game
In the presidential election of 1956, Eisenhower carried 41 states & Stevenson, this many
"Paradise Lost" & the "Aeneid" are divided into this many "books"

rounds.text: The first mammal species sent on a rocket to space, it's perhaps more famous for an antigen in its blood
